identificationModule.briefTitle: Ischemic Post-conditioning in Acute Ischemic Stroke Thrombectomy
identificationModule.officialTitle: Safety and Tolerability of Local Ischemic Post-conditioning in Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke After Mechanical Thrombectomy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Ischemic post-conditioning is a neuroprotective strategy that has been proven to attenuate reperfusion injury in animal models of stroke. The purpose of this proof-of-concept study is to determine the safety and tolerability of ischemic post-conditioning in patients with acute ischemic stroke who are treated with mechanical thrombectomy.

armGroups.label: Ischemic post-conditioning group
armGroups.description: The safety and tolerability of ischemic post-conditioning will be investigated using 3+3 dose-escalation trial design.

interventions.name: Local ischemic post-conditioning
interventions.description: Direct local ischemic post-conditioning will be applied after successful recanalization of the culprit middle cerebral artery. Local ischemic post-conditioning consists of briefly repeated 4 cycles of occlusion and reperfusion (equal duration) of the initially occluded culprit middle cerebral artery using a balloon. The schedule of advancing duration is 0 " 1 " 2 " 3 " 4 " 5 min.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants with major response
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediately after intervention on the day of ischemic post-conditioning

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Related data will be shared if full study protocol and statistical analysis plan are provided with reasonable design.
